attributes.action: The Leave majority is too narrow to warrant exiting the EU without an MP vote.
attributes.additional_details: The UK referendum asking “Should the United Kingdom remain a member of the European Union?” received 48.10% of the vote to Remain. Only 3.8% more voted to Leave. A decision to leave the EU has a colssal impact on the future of the UK, Europe, the EU and the globe, with arguably huge costs to the environment, the economy and humanity as a collective. The elected house must agree by vote that leaving the EU is indeed in the best interest of the electorate, prior to negotiating to leave.
attributes.background: The recent UK referendum was an advisory referendum and given the closeness of the result, should be debated by MP's, then voted on in Parliment, prior to a final decision being taken to leave the EU.
